intro: Agoseris glauca subsp. scorzonerifolia, commonly known as the blue agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features basal leaves that are blue-green in color and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators in its native environment.
